item.title: Ben Hart
item.description: Benjamin M. Hart Senior Scientist Ben is no stranger to drug testing. He worked several years for Keystone Labratories, Inc. doing forensic drug testing. He was the Director of Technology and Certifying Scientist. Ben was in charge of their forensic drug testing lab. He was the chief of personnel, and directed all the new instrument purchases. His skills for instrument maintenance, reviewing and certifying results, and method development made him the ideal candidate to become our Senior Scientist.

item.title: Josh LaVecchia
item.description: Josh LaVecchia Director of Microbiolgy Josh is one of those people that likes to talk about cell physiology, cytology and microscopic technique, immunology, pathogenic microbiology, prokaryotic physiology and genetics, biochemistry, organic and analytical chemistries. That is science nerd to the 4th power. He came to us by way of Texas. He cut his teeth so to speak working for a large testing lab there that did primarily blood testing.

item.title: Stephen Chambers
item.description: Stephen Chambers Science Director As our science director, Stephen’s primary function is to insure that our lab is following GLP (Good Lab Practices). Good Lab Practices isn’t just a phrase, it is a system of requirements that insures that a laboratory, any laboratory, is functioning in a manner that meets basic requirements for acceptable science. More importantly for us, this most important function ensures that your samples’ results are going to be based upon science and that they are a true representation of the sample we are supplied.
